author: norswap
content:
the build.gradle doesn't specify a version so it wil run with whatever you have installed
from a a quick glance it doesn't seem to use java 8 features, so anything 7+ should work
but yeah, don't use that - if you want a java node, use Besu

author: norswap
content:
you need to know the topics you're interested in
you can just take a random topic and decipher it, because it's a hash
more info: https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/a/12951

author: jacq404
content: Hello, where to start with eth ecosystem and DeFi with a software engineer background ? Is the book "Mastering Ethereum" worth diving in (published in 2018) ? Which educational content would you recommend please ?

author: alexanderg3458
content: Hello ser, check dapp University on YouTube, I find his (Greg) tutorials to be a great way to get started with the Ethereum blockchain programing basics

author: newweiv
content: i found that book to be a really helpful overview. the dapp university i found to be less helpful, but that is just my personal experience since i tend to just end up copying on video tutorials

author: alexanderg3458
content: Good point. Maybe dapp University is alright for like a guided approach until you feel comfortable enough to develop by yourself

author: jacq404
content: Nice thanks, have you read any other book that would recommend ? I tend to prefer books than videos to be honest but both can be complementary

author: newweiv
content: it depends on what you want to work on ultimately in the eth ecosystem, but ethereum.org has good articles and the princeton bitcoin & cryptocurrencies also gives a pretty in-depth & rigorous overview of the tech in general
